name: DownloadArtifacrs
description: Downloads the artifacts from a GitHub workflow run
author: Seva Alekseyev
instanceNameFormat: Get the artifacts from $(workflow) on github.com/$(repo)

inputs.name: gh
inputs.label: GitHub service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: A GitHub type service connection to use. The token must have the rights to read actions. Github Enterprise is not supported.

inputs.name: repo
inputs.label: Owner/Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The owner name and the repo name, slash separated.
If your repo is at https://github.com/acme/widgets/, then this parameter should be "acme/widgets".

inputs.name: workflow
inputs.label: Workflow name
inputs.helpMarkdown:
Name of the workflow to get the artifacts from, case insensitive. If blank, the first workflow in the repo will be chosen.
This parameter should match the contents of the `name:` line in your workflow's YAML file on GitHub.

inputs.name: branch
inputs.label: Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: If provided, only actions against the specified branch will be considered. Internally, it's a filter by the "head_branch" property of the run.

inputs.name: artNameFilter
inputs.label: Artifact name(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: If provided, only the artifact with the specified name (case insensitive) will be downloaded, the rest will be ignored. See also the checkbox below.

inputs.name: artNameFilterIsRegex
inputs.label: Name filter is a regular expression
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this to treat the artifact name filter as a regular expression in [JavaScript syntax](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions). Case insensitive match, the filter string is expected to match the whole name.
